Freezing execution
You can freeze the execution of a program by calling proctal_freeze.
int result = proctal_freeze(proctal);
It returns 1 on success, 0 on failure. In case of failure you can call proctal_error to find out what went wrong.
If freezing was successful, you can call proctal_unfreeze to unfreeze the program.
int result = proctal_unfreeze(proctal);
Again, it returns 1 on success, 0 on failure. You can call proctal_error to find out what went wrong.
